StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SP_CHECK_ADDRESS]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
as
declare @ssn varchar(10), @curr_city varchar(20), @curr_cnty varchar(10), @curr_st varchar(10), @hor_city varchar(20), @hor_cnty varchar(10), @hor_st varchar(10), @city_code_c varchar(10), @city_code_h varchar(10), @c_address varchar(10), @h_address varchar(10), @last_updt varchar(10)
declare check_address cursor for select SSN,CURR_CITY, CURR_CNTY, CURR_ST, HOR_CITY, HOR_CNTY, HOR_ST, LAST_UPDT_DTE from arms..ARMS179
open check_address
fetch check_address into @ssn,@curr_city, @curr_cnty, @curr_st, @hor_city, @hor_cnty, @hor_st, @last_updt
while (@@fetch_status = 0)
begin set @city_code_c = (select top 1 CITY_CODE from GEO_LOCATION where COUNTY_CODE = @curr_cnty and STATE_CODE = @curr_st and CITY_TEXT = @curr_city)
set @city_code_h = (select top 1 CITY_CODE from GEO_LOCATION where COUNTY_CODE = @hor_cnty and STATE_CODE = @hor_st and CITY_TEXT = @hor_city)
print @city_code_c print @city_code_h
if @city_code_c is NULL begin if not exists(select 1 from GEO_LOCATION where COUNTY_CODE = @curr_cnty and STATE_CODE = @curr_st) begin insert into arms..ERRORS_179 values (@ssn, @last_updt, 'BAD CURR_ADDRESS',@curr_cnty+'_'+@curr_st) print 'date was no good' end end if @city_code_h is NULL begin if not exists (select 1 from GEO_LOCATION where COUNTY_CODE = @hor_cnty and STATE_CODE = @hor_st) begin insert into arms..ERRORS_179 values (@ssn, @last_updt, 'BAD HOR_ADDRESS', @hor_cnty+'_'+@hor_st) print 'date was no good' end
end fetch check_address into @ssn,@curr_city, @curr_cnty, @curr_st, @hor_city, @hor_cnty, @hor_st, @last_updt
end --all done here
close check_address deallocate check_address
